header.title: Reference Manual DTDs

chapter.p: There are five DTDs for writing manual pages about applications, shell commands, C libraries, Erlang modules and files, all with a similar structure:

list.item: Optional section with the name(s) and email(s) of the author(s).

chapter.p: The differences between the DTDs are the tags for the name, the short summary and some tags inside the "formal" definitions.

section.title: The application DTD
section.p: The application DTD is intended for a Reference Manual and groups a set of manual pages into one unit. The structure is similar to the part DTD: first an introduction and then the manual pages, written in separate files with the appref, comref, cref, erlref, or fileref DTD.
Example:
section.pre:
Application name

Application description...

section.title: <application>
section.p: The top level tag of an application DTD.
Contains a <header>, an optional <description>, followed by one or more <include>.

section.title: The appref DTD
section.p: This is the DTD for writing an application manual page.
Example:
section.pre:
Application name
Application name A short application summary.

A longer description of the application.
Configuration

...

... Name of author Email of author

section.title: <appref>
section.p: The top level tag of an appref DTD.
Contains <header>, <app>, <appsummary>, <description>, zero or more <section> and <funcs>, followed by zero or more <authors>.

section.title: <app>
section.p: The application name. Contains plain text.

section.title: <appsummary>
section.p: Short summary. Contains plain text.

section.title: The comref DTD
section.p: This is the DTD for writing a command manual page.
Example:
section.pre:
Command name
Command name A short command summary.

A long description of the command.

 command command -flag A short command summary (max 40 characters).

An extended command description.

Options

...

Name of author Email of author

section.title: <comref>
section.p: The top level tag for a comref DTD.
Contains <header>, <com>, <comsummary>, <description>, zero or more <section> and <funcs>, followed by zero or more <authors>.

section.title: <com>
section.p: The command name. Contains plain text.

section.title: <comsummary>
section.p: Short summary. Contains plain text.

section.title: The cref DTD
section.p: This is the DTD for writing a C library manual page.
Example:
section.pre:
C library name
C library name A short C library summary.

A longer description of the C library.

 voidstart(bar) voidstart(foo) A short function summary (max 40 characters). char bar int foo

An extended function description.

 ...
A title

Some text...

section.title: <cref>
section.p: The top level tag for a cref DTD.
Contains <header>, <lib>, <libsummary>, <description>, zero or more <section> and <funcs>, followed by zero or more <authors>.

section.title: <lib>
section.p: The C library name or acronym. Contains plain text.

section.title: <libsummary>
section.p: Short summary. Contains plain text.

section.title: The erlref DTD
section.p: This is the DTD for writing Erlang module manual pages.
Example:
section.pre:
Module name
Module name A short module summary.

A longer description of the module.

 start() -> Result start(N) -> Result A short function summary (max 40 characters). Pid = pid() N = int() Result = {ok, Pid} | {error, Reason} Reason = term() A parameter description.

An extended function description.

 ...
Some Title

Some text...

Name of author Email of author

section.title: <erlref>
section.p: The top level tag for an erlref DTD.
Contains <header>, <module>, <modulesummary>, <description>, zero or more <section> and <funcs>, followed by zero or more <authors>.

section.title: <module>
section.p: The module name. Contains plain text.

section.title: <modulesummary>
section.p: Short summary. Contains plain text.

section.title: The fileref DTD
section.p: This is the DTD for writing file manual pages. In OTP, this DTD is used for defining the format of for example .rel and .app files.
Example:
section.pre:
File name
fileref A short file summary.

A longer description of the file.
File format

...

Name of author Email of author
section.p: The file reference manual can also contain function definitions, similar to the erlref DTD.

section.title: <fileref>
section.p: The top level tag for a fileref DTD.
Contains <header>, <file>, <filesummary>, <description>, zero or more <section> and <funcs>, followed by zero or more <authors>.

section.title: <file>
section.p: The name of the file or file type. Contains plain text.

section.title: <filesummary>
section.p: Short summary. Contains plain text.

section.title: <description>
section.p: The introduction after the title and before sections and "formal" definitions.
Contains any combination and any number of block tags except <image> and <table>.

section.title: <section>
section.p:
Subdivisions of the document. Contains an optional <marker>, a <title>,
followed by any combination and any number of block tags except <image> and <table>.

section.title: <funcs>
section.p: A group of "formal" function definitions.
Contains one or more <func>.

section.title: <func>
section.p: A "formal" function definition.
Contains one or more <name>, followed by <fsummary>, <type> (optional) and <desc> (optional).

section.title: <name>
section.p: Function/command signature with name, arguments and return value. Contains plain text, except for the cref DTD where it contains a <ret> (return type, plain text) and a <nametext> (function name and arguments, plain text).
In the case of an erlref DTD, it will automatically be added a marker, <marker id="Name/Arity"> or <marker id="Name">, based on the contents of this tag before the function definition.
Example: Consider the following name definition

Then a marker like this will be added <marker id="foo/2"> before the function definition in the generated HTML. That is, referring to the function using <seealso marker="#foo/2">foo/2</seealso> will automatically work.

section.title: <fsummary>
section.p: Function/command summary. Contains plain text, <c> and <em>.

section.title: <type>
section.p: Type declarations for the function/command.
Contains one or more pairs of <v> and <d> (optional).

section.title: <v>
section.p: Type declaration for an argument or return value. Contains plain text.

section.title: <d>
section.p: Description for an argument or return value. Contains plain text, <c> and <em>.

section.title: <desc>
section.p: Function/command description. Contains block tags except <image> and <table>.

section.title: <authors>
section.p: Authors of the manual page. The authors element is optional.
Contains one or more pairs of <aname> and <email>.

section.title: <aname>
section.p: Author name. Contains plain text.

section.title: <email>
section.p: Author email address. Contains plain text.
